Thinking out loud
Current head: (7, 7)  
Possible moves:
• LEFT → (6, 7) – contains an apple, but enemy head is at (5, 7). If the enemy moves RIGHT we’d meet head-on in the same square; equal lengths ⇒ very likely double-kill. Too risky.  
• RIGHT → (8, 7) – empty, safe, but no apple and still leaves us beside the enemy.  
• DOWN → (7, 6) – our own tail’s square. Because we wouldn’t be eating an apple this turn, the tail would vacate and we’d survive, but it keeps us close to the enemy and doesn’t advance toward new apples.  
• UP → (7, 8) – empty, safely moves away from the enemy and from any immediate collision threats. Gives us room to evaluate next apple (perhaps (0, 9) along the top edge) while the enemy decides what to do with the (6, 7) apple.

Chosen move
Play it safe and head upward.

Strategy for next turn
• Re-assess after the enemy either grabs or bypasses the (6, 7) apple.  
• From (7, 8) we can continue toward (0, 9) along the top or swing right toward (8, 8) / (9, 8) depending on how the board shifts.
